instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message:
one of the USB ports not working. One of the diodes have fallen off. im trying to salvage one from a donor board but the closest thing i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? Can anyone tell me if I could use one of those diodes?

thanks in advance

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message:
They seem close enough (5.3V-0.22pF), but are you sure this what's preventing usb from not working?
They act like transient voltage suppressor/esd and rf interference stuff...look for further damage, do you get 5v on L4605 pin 2 and check continuity on L4600 filter.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message: It should work without the diodes. Just for testing though, they should be installed again for ESD protection.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message: Yes i should of mentioned. The usb werent working regardless - however I scratched one of these off by accident when poking around and also wanted to replace as pre-caution.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message: hey guys. 5v present on L4605. continuity present on L4600 filter but port still dont work?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message: Diode mode on pin 5,6 of J4600? Check <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> area, check voltage on pin 10. Did you check if J4600 is damaged?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A USB issue
threads.message:
i was suspecting <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> it looks good. j4600 looks good

j4600 pin 5,6 is .500 .505

on <RESISTOR>R4650</RESISTOR> there is 3.42 - having said that i removed the <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> and the [B]only [/B]pin corroded is pin 10!!

LESSON learnt: dont be lazy - never underestimate under chips!

thanks duke!
